text: I don't exactly spend a ton of time inside the DataFrames repo, so maybe I'm not the one who should be askign this, but I did have occasion to check it out a few times lately, and while I am glad the package is so well documented, I find the huge doc strings extremely obnoxious when looking at code.  Would you guys be open to moving the long ones to separate files?  (this is very easy and already supported by the docs system, see my comment in <#C6FGJ8REC|appreciation>)

text: Maybe text editors' "julia modes" could offer the ability to "fold" (i.e. collapse) doc strings?  That would actually be quite useful IMHO.  Maybe some already support that?

text: yeah, it shouldn't be too hard to get most editors to do code folding.  I personally hate code folding for reasons that are not necessarily applicable to this particular case (I find it very obnoxious to manage).  For me personally, having super long docs in separate files seems like a no-brainer, but as this really doesn't affect anyone who is not working directly on a package at all, only the opinions of the most active maintainers seem relevant here
